results.brief_description: Shows the specific steps to follow in organising an informal adult discussion group. Shows the method of setting up a discussion group an dealing with problems that may arise.

results.title: Organised games in the junior school
results.creator_credit: Attico Films and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: The film deals with the structure of the games lesson for third and fourth year junior children. The main features of children’s play are discussed and from these evolve the basic requirements of the schools games program. Emphasis is given to the preparation, special organisation and deployment of apparatus.

results.title: Organisation of the body
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description: Shows, in broad outline, the skeletal, muscular, vascular, respiratory, excretory, endocrine and nervous systems of the human body, and demonstrates the interdependence of these systems and their collaboration in the life of the body as a whole.

results.title: Ordinary streets
results.creator_credit: Eddie Moses, Film Victoria and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: The second part of a trilogy on contemporary issues in public housing. The film examines the complexities of urban planning and the processes by which decisions are taken focussing on the William Angliss Project in Footscray, a suburb of Melbourne, Victoria. Uses archival footage, aerial shots and stills.

results.title: Ord irrigation
results.creator_credit: T.K. Lloyd and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: A survey of one aspect of Australia’s plans to settle her north. The Ord River Project is based on two dams which irrigate the land for cotton farms. A modern township, Kununurra, has been built.

results.title: Oranges are not the only fruit
results.creator_credit: Beeban Kidron, Phillippa Giles and Second Sight Television
results.brief_description: Jeannette Winterson adapted the screenplay for this BBC television series from her semi-autobiographical best-selling novel of the same name. The series follows the story of Jess (Charlotte Coleman), a young girl, and her relationships with her adoptive mother - an outrageously fanatical Evangelist; the church - including an equally devout pastor and flock; and the people of her small township in Northern England. In accordance with her mother’s wishes, Jess is set to train as a missionary. However, when her relationship with local girl, Melanie, is exposed as more than friendship, ensuing tensions propel Jess’ arduous journey of self-discovery on a more difficult and changed trajectory than she had planned. The story of Jess’ hardwon escape from the township is treated with both tragedy and black humour. This series won three BAFTA awards including Best Serial and Best Actress.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beeban Kidron, Phillippa Giles and Second Sight Television

results.title: Oranges and lemons
results.creator_credit: Margot Lethlean and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A documentary on the early education of aboriginal children. It looks at a special pre-school program to help prepare aboriginal children for school, which has been set up in Dareton, Victoria. It suggests that in the face of insensitive attitudes, conventional education will further undermine aboriginal culture.

results.title: Orange and blue
results.creator_credit: Jane Chermayeff, Peter Chermayeff, Contemporary Films and Harvard Film Service, Harvard University

results.title: Orange
results.brief_description: Nature’s element - the movements of sun, clouds, light and shadows play the leading roles in this film. We witness the virth of a day when the first glow of morning grows to a blinding red of boiling clouds. Into this primordial atmosphere intrudes man’s machines, aeroplanes - nature rebels with explosive holocaust. Made with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission.
